resources.string:
This application has been designed and developed by:

 		Diego Esteban Moreno
 		Félix Huete García

 As a final project for the University of Valladolid of Engineering degree in Computer Systems.


Tutors:

 		Miguel Ángel González Rebollo
 		Manuel Ángel González Delgado
The application shows use of the accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer, light sensor, proximity sensor and GPS, as well as measurement tool in physics laboratories.\n
Sensor Mobile is an application designed as display unit of sensors on your Android device.\n
Select sampling frequency, number of samples per second.
Select time elapses since enter in the graphic screen until it begins to record.

It is a device that measures acceleration, rate of change of velocity of an object, and the forces induced by gravity, i.e., allows us to detect the movement and rotation.\n This is measured in meters per second squared (m / s2) or forces g (g).\n

The main constituent is a capacitor, a device that is usually composed of two fixed metal plates facing each other and a dielectric material.
 One of these plates is mobile. When you apply a force to the device, the capacity will increase or decrease depending on the movement.
 The energy comes through these plates from the battery device into the capacitor. The dielectric material between these plates will be able to store a charge or another depending on whether the capacitor is higher or lower.
 This procedure will allow the sensor to measure how much electrical charge (voltage) is stored in the dielectric material and send that information to the microprocessor device to determine the force and acceleration that has been submitted. The microprocessor has recorded the voltage obtained and saved in a database which had already been recorded other voltages, corresponding to a force and to a certain acceleration.
An accelerometer can automatically change the screen orientation and detect vertical or horizontal position of the screen.\n
The accelerometer measures the acceleration applied to the device and its features are summarized in the table.
A gyroscope is a mechanical device that helps us to measure, maintain and change the orientation of a device. I.e., it measures the rotational speed (rad / s).\n

It is based on the angular momentum. It uses a micro electromechanical technology (MEMS) with a silicon sensor thanks to special plates that act as capacitors. Intensity changes are converted into digital data and that is what reads the microprocessor.
 Once the gyroscope sets in motion always maintains the orientation and it is oriented to the true north. The gyro gives us a precise orientation, it indicates the displacement on their axes and gives us the position regarding the exact starting point.
 MENS (Microelectromechanical Systems, MEMS) refer to the electromechanical technology, their micrometer products and smaller scales (nanometer scale) are merged into nanoelectromechanical systems.
The gyroscope give us the possibility to turn your screen.\n

The gyroscope measures the speed of rotation of the device around the x, y, and z axis.The values of the gyro data can be positive or negative. Looking at the origin of a position along the mid-axis positive, if the rotation occurs to the left side around the axis, the value is positive; Otherwise, the value is negative. We can also determine the direction of a gyroscope value.\n
It is an electronic component capable of measuring and quantifying the magnetic force of an object. I.e. it measures the magnetic field (µT).\n

The main constituent is an electromagnet with an iron core with a coil of wire wrapped.\n The magnetism changes depending on the location due to differences in (the magnetosphere) Earth\'s magnetic field and can be caused by the different nature of the rocks. Magnetometers are a frequent instrumental component of spacecraft that explores planets and for geological exploration for anticlinal structures.\n
As well as a compass, it can serve as a metal detector.\n
The most important use of the magnetometer (described in table) in Android systems is to implement the compass.\n

It is an electronic device that responds to the change in light intensity. These sensors require a transmitter that generates light and a receptor component that receives light generated by the transmitter.\n

The light sensor includes a photoelectric transducer to convert the light into an electrical signal and may include electronics for signal conditioning and formatting the compensation signal.\n The most common light sensor is Light Dependant Resistor. A LDR is basically a resistor that changes its resistance when light intensity changes. There are three types of photoelectric sensors, sensors for light barrier, reflection on mirror or reflection on objects.\n
Its function is to detect the intensity of the ambience light to adjust the screen brightness.\n
The system uses the ambient light sensor, described in the table, to detect the ambience lighting and automatically adjust the screen brightness to the appropriate level.\n
Se trata de un sensor capaz de medir la distancia entre el móvil y algún otro objeto. El sensor de proximidad se mide en centímetros (cm).\n

These proximity sensors are based on an infra-red LED and an IR receiver. How does it work? It emits infra-red light and it detects if there is something very close to the device. In the case of a call, would be the ear.\n

When the device is approached to our ear to answer a call, the device turns off the backlight to save battery.
 Besides, if we touch the screen by accident while we are on a call, nothing will happen because the proximity sensor locks the screen to prevent such errors.
 Usually, if the device is dark it is almost imperceptible but if we look to the light we see it, if it has, of course.

The proximity sensor provides the distance between the device and another object. The device can be used to detect if the user holds the device near (see table); therefore, you can determine if the user is on a call and if the screen can be turned off during the phone call\n
Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) which allows us to set global position of an object, a person, a vehicle or a ship.\n

The GPS is based on the triangulation, a mathematical principle that determines the exact position of a point knowing the distances from a known location to three points. Three satellites are used to determine the position, speed and height of receiver.\n
The GPS indicates paths, routes or location.\n
In the main screen you can choose between:\n

Measurement data:
 	sensor measures will be showing here.
 Load graph:
 	Every graph you have saved are listed in this screen.
 In the menu you will find SETTINGS button with 4 options:
Sensor device: list of sensors device.\n

Language: You can choose Auto, English, Spanish, French or Portuguese.
 	Below settings divider you can see other three options:
 			Sampling frequency: number of samples per second.
 			Timer: time elapsed since we enter in the graphic screen until it begins to record.
 			Recording time.
 About: Information about the application privacy and their developers
 Help: Manual of the application.
Sensor device and their measures. This screen is divided:\n

Sensor information (buttons):
 	Accelerometer
 	Gyroscope
 	Magnetometer
 	Proximity sensor
 	Light sensor
 	GPS
 
Below every button information you can see:
 	Checkbox save data: if it is checked data will be saved in csv file.
 	Graph icone: Start graph screen where data will be represented.
 	Muestra de datos: sensor measures in real time.
 There are application preferences in this menu:
 			Sampling frequency: number of samples per second.
 			Timer: time elapsed since we enter in the graphic screen until it begins to record.
 			Recording time.
 About: Information about the application privacy and their developers
 Help: Manual of the application.
Data are represented in this screen.\n

Screen schema:
 	Start button: graph will start.
 	Botón Pause/Stop: Stop or pause the data representation.
 	Reset: will be pressed to start a new representation of the graph.
 Below these button:
 	Checkbox: may be selected depending on what data you want to display.
 	REC: green if not checked save data in Measurement Data screen, else this icone is red.
 	GPS signal: state of gps (searching or off).
 	Graph: the data collected by the device are represented.
 Once started the representation of measurements, you can switch from one sensor to another, share or save it in CSV format (menu).

In this screen you can see all files saved. If you select a file it will show the representation of the measurements. If you push for an extended period of time, the file may be sent via the option you want.\n Once selected if you want to remove from the list to send, press and hold on the same file and remain unchecked.\n
Multiples files may be selected to send.\n

The information screens sensor (gyroscope, accelerometer, magnetometer, light sensor, proximity sensor and GPS) shows the explanation of each sensor. Each screen is structured:
 	About: explanation about the sensor and measuring
 	How it works: explaining the operation of sensor.
 	Purpose : sensor utility.
 	What it measures: measures taken by the sensor on the Android device.
